website_summaries.verdict: Rugged and durable, this machine can slice fruits and vegetables in a large variety of ways.
cons: Making long, continuous strands of food is a skill that must be honed

customer_reviews.title: Just not effective...
customer_reviews.text: Just no effective...I don't know where those great reviews are coming from unless those folks are only using zucchini. Tried for quite a while to spiralize a carrot and all I got were little c-shaped chunks, unattractive and not what I wanted. Watched a youtube video and the seasoned user doing the video got the same sort of chunks using a sweet potato but seemed to want me to think that was the desired results...nope, want spirals. The suction cups do not stay attached to the counter by a long shot. I already have a mandolin to slice things thing so this is just not a useful addition if it's not going to spiralize. Was really hoping to like it.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Zoodled our whole kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is super cool. I made zoodles and put them in soup. The guests I had over were super impressed. We started spiralizing every vegetable we could find. Ended up making some delicious fries to go with the soup. My son adores them and will settle for these fries over any fast food. The cork screws are so long, it makes it super fun. One thing to keep in mind, THESE BLADES ARE NOT MESSING AROUND. THEY ARE SHARP. I am still not sure how (was washing it...carefully I thought), but I cut my finger very deeply on one. Please click yes if this review was helpful to you! :)
customer_reviews.author: Seeking Bliss

customer_reviews.title: Only for soft foods!
customer_reviews.text: After just one year of VERY light use (zucchinis only, it couldn't handle a sweet potato), the handle of my spiral slicer broke off into five plastic pieces. I wasn't even in the kitchen at the time. There it was sitting on the kitchen counter, we heard something breaking and I walk into the handle on the counter wtih the connector in multiple pieces. Not only could this item barely handle a zucchini but it could NEVER a sweet potato. This item was NOT worth the $26 I paid for it. I don't know why everyone loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea C

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time...
customer_reviews.text: It didn't do what it said it would do. Firstly, you have to assemble the slicer. It doesn't take long, but it's an unnecessary hassle. Then, you have to slice the vegetables. You would think this would be the best part, right?? NO! It takes a lot of effort to even slice the vegetables let alone spiralize them into the shapes shown in the pictures. The only reason I rated it one star was because when I sent my purchase back, I received a refund almost immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Jillian

customer_reviews.title: So basic, so perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! It is perfect for cucumber salads, spiraled zucchini and carrots. I eat one entire cucumber a day because of this little machine. I will state however, BE CAREFUL WITH THE BLADES! I was sloppy and pulled up too roughly to remove the blade attachment and ended up in the ER with 6 stitches (spiraled pinky anyone?) lol. The box warns you repeatedly to be careful so please heed their advice and dry your hands before you remove the blade attachment.
customer_reviews.author: BayBoyCA

customer_reviews.title: Help
customer_reviews.text: I have wanted one of these-- and I looked at a lot of reviews before buying.. I am not happy with this spiralizer. I cannot get the leg suctions to stick to my counter-- I have tried everything-- moving it to another counter also.. They seem dried out -- that may be the problem. So when I try to use it-- it scoots all over the counter and I cannot push the vegetable in while spiraling. The only way I could use it is if I have someone to hold it still while using. I live alone so that is not possible. I really want one that works.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Paderno 3 in 1 spiralizer. Don’t buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: I used the paderno 3 in 1spiralizer to make spiralized potatoes. I found it difficult to use as you need to apply pressure to the side handle at the same time you’re turning the other handle. I use Yukon gold potatoes and they’re pretty soft. Can’t imagine trying sweet potatoes. Very awkward! When I used it last, the side handle broke completely off. I always hand wash so it’s definitely not caused from the dishwasher. I will say I’ve had it for almost 4 years so I got my monies worth. However I would not recommend this machine. I’m ordering an electric one this time. Hopefully it will work better!!
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: So Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I have always wanted to make Zoodles and other spiralized veggies but never had the courage to buy one, especially not knowing which product would really do the job without being a big hassle. This product was recommended by a reliable source, so I decided to give it a try and bought it as a gift for my hubby who is my “sous chef” who does most of the chopping, slicing and dicing when we prepare dinner. We checked it out, making shrimp scampi with zoodles, and we were amazed how easily it assembled, could be used, and then cleaned. We loved the zoodles and are looking forward to making them again. And best of all, it was quite affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Lee Carter

customer_reviews.title: It makes quick work of spiralizing "zoodles"
customer_reviews.text: We are generally overrun with zucchini at this time of year, and so I ordered this specifically to make zucchini noodles -- because we are also overrun with tomatoes! Lots of spaghetti with fewer carbs than using "real" noodles. I haven't tried it with other veggies yet, but I'm beginning to plan my strategies! Just two tips: The end of the vegetable MUST be sliced off totally evenly. A slight slant in the end makes it very difficult to spiralize. And... The directions say this is dishwasher-safe, but I find it really easy just to rinse it off in hot water and then leave it to air dry. It's a pretty awkward shape to put into the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Doterling

customer_reviews.title: Makes eating vegetables more interesting
customer_reviews.text: Put some yellow and green zucchini along with some onions through this and was able to make a delicious and healthy pan-sauteed meal. Pieces are modular and easy to manipulate as well as remove for cleaning. As razor blades go, you must be careful while cleaning. The sucktion action was not happening on my wood table, but that was a given. Fortunately, if you use the grip and the handle, you can still manuever fine and get your spiral cuttings. I have only used it a couple of times and am not sure how long it will last. The plastic does look delicate but the shapes and fittings seem to be well designed for quick cleaning, storing away, and ergonomics.
customer_reviews.author: katrina finley

customer_reviews.title: Returning it after one use
customer_reviews.text: (By Jeffrey's wife) The instructions were completely inadequate. I am not mechanically oriented, and if my husband were not an extremely handy engineer, I never would have figured out how to assemble and use it. Once he assembled and demo'ed it for me, I could use it, but just barely. It's awkward and fiddly and you have to have good strength in both hands to hold the machine steady while spiralizing, and my left hand is not strong. (I was only doing zucchini and apples, not anything super-hard.) Just too much hassle and it would take up precious space in my cupboard. It's going back immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff & Wife

customer_reviews.title: Okay Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on recommendation from a website without doing any research - bad idea. It works very well but there are much better ones for the same price. The veges fall to the side and you have to put a square dish to catch it, it will not work with a circular dish. My other issue is with the suction that keeps it from moving. It does not stay put with much pressure, it keeps coming loose and moving. Once you get over the annoying design it does work, the blades are very sharp and you get perfect spiralized fruits and vegetables.
customer_reviews.author: Trini1

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to use or clean!
customer_reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE! I don't know why there's so many high starts review on this item, but it's a pain to use it and clean it. It doesn't suction at all, the vegetables go all over the place, you need to put your back into it for it to grate the vegetables and cleaning it's a pain -- literally. I cut up my fingers and the thing is still dirty. I will be throwing it away. I wish I could return it but I waited too long. It's truly the worst thing I've ever bought.
customer_reviews.author: Islarose

customer_reviews.title: do not purchase if looking to use for carrots.
customer_reviews.text: I loved thick strings of carrots on my salads. So I purchased this thinking that I could use for carrots....but when you tried the carrots would not remain pinned in between the handle and end and just fell. The carrot would have to be the size of a zucchini in order to work. was perfectly worthless for my purposes but maybe would work for zucchini noodles. I don't know.
customer_reviews.author: so. cal coffee

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use spiralizer!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second spiralizer I've purchased, and I am very happy with it! It is easy to use and the veggies come out perfectly. A few things to be aware of.... you'll need a plate or bowl to capture the zoodles as they come out. The blade itself is difficult to clean but the rest of the spiralizer cleans up quickly. The platform is solid and doesn't move when placed on a flat surface. The end results - veggie 'noodles' - come out wonderfully. I haven't tried the ribbon blade yet. If this spiralizer is durable then it's definitely worth 4, or maybe 5 stars. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Okay, could be better
customer_reviews.text: This is not such a bad little machine. It does what its supposed to most of the time. Some problems: the sucker feet don't always want to stick, and even if they do, the force of spiraling makes it wander sometimes. The body, while durable enough to keep it from actually breaking, is too flexible, especially the handle. I think if you use this occasionally for soft things like zucchini (avoid yellow squash, the seedy mush in the middle clogs this machine right up), you'll be okay. If you want an everyday workhorse, especially for hard stuff like beets or potatoes, you should invest in something sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: Grelnok

customer_reviews.title: The ONLY spiralizer you'll ever need
customer_reviews.text: This is the spiralizer I've needed for years. No more hand cramps from a hand twist model. In 30 seconds, I flew through an entire large garden zucchini making beautiful "zoodles" that were just the right diameter for an "al dente" zoodle. No one likes zoodles that are thin and mushy.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl M.

customer_reviews.title: You got to try this...
customer_reviews.text: Ok, it looks cheap, but I love this thing. Spiral cutting and slicing is just so easy and quick. The sliding latte approach was a little awkward, but positioning it on a cutting mat solved that. Finely diced onions for the my chili dogs and relish is now a breeze and spiraled carrots and cucumbers have improved my salads from 3 to 4 stars, per she who must be obeyed.
customer_reviews.author: GrayTiger

customer_reviews.title: Great for veggies, not really for chips or curly fries
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice quality spiral cutter for the price. Fantastic for cucumbers, onions and other vegetables. On the other hand, if you plan on making potato chips or curly fries, you may be disappointed. The cutter blades for curly fries is too thin. It ends up making rectangular shaped fries instead of square, a small matter that may only bother me. For regular spiral cutting the potato is to thick to make a good chip. The edge gets crispy but the center stays soft. So if you're looking for something to give your everyday veggies some pizzazz, I love spiral cut onions, then this is for you! If looking forward to chips or curly fries, I'd try looking elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Rudolph Yaber

customer_reviews.title: Parent tested, kid approved!
customer_reviews.text: We went to Wholefoods the other day, and they were selling zucchini noodles in the produce section. It wasn't expensive, but it wasn't cheap either. We've made our money back buy spiralizing our zucchini or squash, and we're healthier for it! Most importantly, the kids actually enjoy eating vegetables that are spiralized, so as a parent, this is great! The tool is easy to use, easy to clean, and cuts perfectly. With some careful parenting eyes, we allow our boys to spiralize their squash, which of course makes them want to eat it too! It's just a win win! This is definitely a necessity to any household with kids.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: I'm not eating zoodles every night like I thought I would be....
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this and pictured myself eating zoodles everything once I got it. I think this is hard to get and stay suctioned to my laminate countertop. I think it's hard to crank when you have something firm in it like sweet potato. The few times I used it, I couldn't get my sweet potatoes to cook up right and ended up with burned on the outside and raw in the middle of my sweet potato spirals. I don't love cleaning this thing either.
customer_reviews.author: CHOEK

customer_reviews.title: Crank breaks easily.
customer_reviews.text: I got this in dec 2015 and it broke almost immediately (the crank plastic shattered) during normal use. The seller replaced the item (which I was happy about) because it was so soon after purchasing. I was spiralizing sweet potato last night and the same break happened again. 1 year is hardly a long enough life span for a kitchen product, especially since I only use it once or twice a month. Disappointed in the quality, but then again, I probably should have spent the extra $20 on a different model.
customer_reviews.author: Katie S

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed that I couldn't do raw beets, carrots, parsnips, etc., with this spiralizer. I had envisioned beautiful multicolored spiralized salads, etc. The picture certainly shows carrots and beets, but they were just too dense for this appliance, as the recipe book that I purchased to go with it stated. That book suggested a Vegetti spiralizer for those denser vegetables. In addition, the Padrerno wouldn't stay clamped on my countertop (granite) and it kept moving as I tried to use it. It worked great with zucchini (fexcept for having to chase it down the counter) but I couldn't see any point in keeping it just for zucchini. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for zucchini, not so great for sweet potato
customer_reviews.text: Great for making zucchini noodles, but it's very difficult to make long sweet potato noodles. It took my husband and me, 2 persons, to work it through hard vegetables like sweet potatoes to make noodles.
customer_reviews.author: A. Tan

customer_reviews.title: but this spiralizer allows me to enjoy my "pasta"by making it healthy
customer_reviews.text: With the recent boom in natural nutrition, this Paderno World Cuisine spiralizer is an absolute necessity in every kitchen. You can take almost any vegetable and turn it into noodles or slices. I was concerned with eating pasta for dinners and having such a heavy carbohydrate load before bed , but this spiralizer allows me to enjoy my "pasta"by making it healthy. Top zucchini noodles with your favorite pesto or marinara sauce and you have a perfectly healthy meal. This product literally does all the work for you- you simply turn the wheel and watch your noodles pop out. Great seller and fast shipping as well. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: This actually works
customer_reviews.text: I will admit I was pretty skeptical, but my wife wanted it to jazz up vegetables we serve to the family. It works exactly as advertised. We haven't had a single problem. This is a really impressive product. It felt a little on the light side and I thought the product wouldn't hold up to repeated uses. Fortunately the suction cups on the base of the legs really does stick and so far, we've pushed through multiple cucumbers, carrots, and even potatoes without a complaint. Our personal favorite blade is the smaller holed, single strand of spaghetti blade. It literally turns a whole cucumber into a entire plate of cucumber-spaghetti. It makes eating the vegetable a different experience entirely.
customer_reviews.author: L. Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Great kitchen tool!
customer_reviews.text: This Paderno performs well and I have been using and enjoying it for two years now. My favorite thing to do is spiralize zucchini and summer squash, saute for 3-5 minutes in coconut oil, salt and pepper, a handful of cashews or pine nuts or almonds and enjoy alone or topped with anything that is improved with a bed of noodles. It really is a great addition to my kitchen and helps me provide healthy and tasty meals.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: I bought this spiralizer because it was recommended by America's Test Kitchen. I have been using it every day to spiralize zucchini from my garden. It is easy to use and easy to clean. I never liked zucchini that much, but the spiralizer makes it delicious. I use the blade that cuts it like spaghetti, and I saute it in butter, garlic, salt, and pepper. Once it's cooked, I add marinara sauce and cook until the sauce is heated. I serve with Parmesan. Delicious!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works nice
customer_reviews.text: Works well and easy to use. The only thing I have used it for is to spiral zucchini into zoodles. It holds up well in the dishwasher. It is a little clumsy to use, the suction cups don't stick well to my counter so I feel like I need 3 hands to keep it still, hold the zucchini, and crank the handle.
customer_reviews.author: KNoelle

customer_reviews.title: Not heavy or stable enough to REALLY get the job done.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second type of vegetable pasta slicer I've ordered. There is no way this is a one person operation. It takes one person to turn the handle and one to press to make sure vegetables are tight enough to slice properly. Now I'm going to start looking for an attachment for the Robo Coupe/Cuisinart that will do the same thing...tired of mucking around. I want something that will do the job. Veggie pasta is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: hkgypsy

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to spiralize squash into spaghetti or zucchini into something akin to macaroni. It must take a better woman than me to get actual spirals that look like spaghetti out of this thing. It's difficult to use as well. There's like a set of rules that actually go with spiralizing vegetables to the point where they actually resemble spaghetti. It's also fairly difficult to clean and I've cut my fingers several times on the blades trying to dislodge vegetables. I rarely use it now. It is NOT WORTH THE MONEY and the trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Jae

customer_reviews.title: A must have gadget and the perfect gift for anyone!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a portable spiralizer ti take with me on my travels. I chose thia one based on good reviews. When it arrived, I was skeptical, thinking it might not be up to the task of noodling my veggies. Eager to experience my own home made zoodles, I got started. It was so quick, easy, and perfect. For the next half hour....no veggie in my crisper was safe. I don't rave about a product unless it truly deserves it. This spiralizer is a must for every kitchen. My son enjoyed it so much that he nabbed mine. So.....you guessed it. I am ordering another one for myself and extras for gifts this year. Salude!
customer_reviews.author: 1Sunkat

customer_reviews.title: Great quality spiralizer!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly, easy to clean. The plastic is sturdy, the suction cups work well, the blades are very sharp! Check out Against All Grain by Danielle Walker - she has an online video showing you how to make zucchini noodles with this. There is another book we are checking out called Inspiralized, again there are online resources along with the book. It's definitely a bulky item for storage and not terrible attractive on a shelf, but something you can get in the habit of using often! Be careful when you get to the end of your veggie item - if you press too hard the plastic spikes that hold the veggie in place can get a trim from the blade.
customer_reviews.author: C. Frederick

customer_reviews.title: Easiest spiralizer I have used
customer_reviews.text: On the plus side, it does a great job on zucchini (which is all that I've used it for and that's why I bought it). On the "needs improvement" side, the suction cups only work marginally, and even then only on a very smooth surface (NOT your cutting board).
customer_reviews.author: Gary Evans

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price! Works on all types of veggies/fruit. I've even used it for harder veggies like rutabaga and sweet potatoes with no issues. The blade has remained sharp even after over a year of use. The only issue I had with it is that the suction cups on the feet don't stick well on all counter tops. If your counter top is shiny it doesn't stick as well. Also, if you wait too long to clean the blade inserts they can be hard to clean. Love that it can be thrown in the dishwasher. My kids love to use it too. Makes great curly fries and zoodles.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie L. Young

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: We love zoodles and this makes them quickly and easily. I love the different size options, and we've enjoyed trying different veggies in here as well. Love that it stores compactly. I wish it was slightly easier to exchange/remove the blades. I feel like they snap in just a tad too tight. This tool is also 100% right handed which really frustrates me as a lefty. Often it's a 2 person job with someone applying the pressure in the direction of the blade and the second turning the handle. I think it'd be a lot easier if I could use my left hand.
customer_reviews.author: mc2cmt

customer_reviews.title: Saves time and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to try making zoodles or zucchini noodles. It took a couple tries to figure out the best placement of the veggie to use it. I didn't anchor it in the first time and sent a zucchini crashing to the floor. Once you figure out the sweet spot to securing your veggie, it's a super simple device to use. Just turn the handle and voila--veggie noodles. This was even easier and far less time consuming than I expected. Highly recommend if you want to make veggie noodles.
customer_reviews.author: Nora

customer_reviews.title: Great spiralizer and a good value
customer_reviews.text: This may deserve 5 stars but I haven't used it enough to say that. Once I figured out how to switch the blades (thank you Paderno customer service), I found it very easy to use and clean. I've only used it with zucchini and cucumbers. I made the small sized noodles out of zucs and they're good raw or sauteed. I used the ribbon blade on a cuke and made a delicious cold salad with a little sour cream and dill. My friend has a garden overflowing with zucs. I bought one for her and I think she's made zuc noodles every night since. The 5 star test will be if I can make sweet potato noodles with this.
customer_reviews.author: Julie W.

customer_reviews.title: Handle falls off, prong attachment pin does is not threaded and the handle is threaded!
customer_reviews.text: I used mine for the first time today. When I first assembled it, I thought it was odd that the handle did not stay on and there were no threads on the prong that it attaches to. I put it in the cabinet and when I used it, just as I suspected, it didn't work. The suction cups did not work either. I just ordered a replacement prong from Paderno site that appears to have the threads on it. I shouldn't have to do this on a new item. It was a special price but not if it doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Graham

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: I spent a lot of time researching the different spiralizers and I'm happy to say that this was a great purchase. It took me a few minutes to figure out and I'm deducting one star because it would be nice if they labeled the different blades without having to test it out and ruin a good vegetable by using the wrong blade. But honestly it's a great product, the suctions keep it in place on the counter and it's very easy to use. This is something that even an elderly person could easily use as you need very minimal effort, it's just a matter of turning a crank with no muscle needed
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: The best on the market
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to cut out the carbs and replace with veggies. I use this at least once a week and it provides a perfect noodle every time. I had purchased another brand out of stainless steal and the hand held spiralizer, and this one in comparison is by far the best. You can use it with varies veggies and fruits. Great if you are trying to eat healthier.
customer_reviews.author: Mmperry

customer_reviews.title: nice quality, didn't really need it...or at least I don't really ever seem to use it
customer_reviews.text: It's fine but the punch in the middle that holds the vegs in place is really fat, wasting a lot of the vegetable and making incompatible with all except the largest vegetables. This is however I high quality and I do think it's neat. I just don't use it, well ever. For slicing and grating I would use my cuisinart food processor (I wrote a review). So I would use this for vegetable spaghetti... Maybe they need to include a booklet or something with suggestions for use/ recipes... because that is really the only use I can think of.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Seriously in love with this!
customer_reviews.text: The Spiralizer is absolutely amazing! easy to use super easy to clean makes food fun and easy! I was surprised how well the suction legs work on it...it makes eating you least favorite veggies exciting! (Works awesome with picky eaters too!) makes soups, Stirfries, curly fries, hashbrowns, fresh green salads and coleslaw exciting! Seriously one of my best purchases ever! BUY THIS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: Kai

customer_reviews.title: It's easy to use & easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I use this all the time. It's easy to use & easy to clean. I make spiralized veggies 3 - 4 times a week, so it gets a work out. I've used zucchinis, some kind of Asian squash I get at the Farmer's Market, carrots, sweet potatoes, regular potatoes, beets, turnips, parsnips, and butternut squash so far. Sometimes the rubber feet move around during the process, especially when the veggie juice is running everywhere, but it's no big deal. It's sturdy enough to handle all of those veggies, and I'm not super delicate with it. Highly recommend. Buy the Inspiralized cookbook by Ali Maffucci (and check out her blog) and start spiralizing! Delicious & healthy.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela G. Maher

customer_reviews.title: Everyone I knew was spiralizing vegetables into pretty looking noodles
customer_reviews.text: Everyone I knew was spiralizing vegetables into pretty looking noodles. Then, my supermarket started selling blister packed squash noodles for $3.99. I decided I wanted to make my own, using many different vegetables. After reading many reviews, I decided to buy the Paderno Tri-Blade Spriralizer. I have not been disappointed. It easily creates lovely squash, potato and onion curls. I haven't used beets yet, but I don't doubt my success. I recommend this tool for anyone looking for a different way to eat vegetables.
customer_reviews.author: Debra M.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful gadget!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this, and am having so much fun with zucchini, I haven't tried anything else. It works like a dream. No problem with the suction holding it down. I have arthritis in my hands, so I opted for this one with a handle rather than the kind you have to twist by hand, and I'm so glad I did. Easy to clean, easy to use. There are 3 blades for 3 thicknesses of curls. I'm so glad I researched this and looked at reviews. This one is a keeper. Can't wait to try some other recipes and veggies.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqui Tolin

customer_reviews.title: Was great until end broke that holds zucchini in end.  Thought it felt funny!
customer_reviews.text: I loved how this Paderno World Cuisine worked and was making Zoodles - but then the end that holds the veggies on broke! I have no idea how to contact the seller to see if they could send me that part! I did not misuse it and mad because it broke. I threw out the box and don't want to pay to ship back because of one piece. I guess no more zoodle Zucchini for me :-( My sister saw mine, I did order one for her and she picked it up yesterday. I showed her my pice that broke and she said she hoped her end that holds on the veggie does not break!
customer_reviews.author: DMD

customer_reviews.title: PLASTIC kitchen appliance (for lack of a better term) could be THIS AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how a simple, somewhat small-ish, PLASTIC kitchen appliance (for lack of a better term) could be THIS AWESOME! Seriously, it works like a charm, the cleanup is ridiculously easy and it FEELS like quality... both in use and in manufacturing. We have used this to make fast curly fries at some of our crazy family and friends events and I bet we've sold about a dozen of these to various attendees (I see them taking pictures of it with their phone too). Don't hesitate for one second to add this to your kitchen appliance line-up!!! This is a REAL WINNER!!
customer_reviews.author: K. Shields

customer_reviews.title: LOVE my Spiralizer!
customer_reviews.text: Great for making zoodles or cucumber ribbons for pretty salads. Easy to use and easy clean up. Had a hard time with sweet potato but cucumber, zucchini, red onion, fat carrots, and more work quite nicely. Many recipes online but it's nice to have a book on the shelf with spiralized recipes. Or maybe I just sometimes like "old school"....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great tool to get more veggies in
customer_reviews.text: I'm mostly plant based and wanted a different way to eat vegetables. So far I've only used it on broccoli stalks, zucchini, and carrots. I love it! It takes a little bit of work to spiralize the veggies, but it's ok. Cleaning can be hard if there are pieces stuck under the blade, but it's ok also. At ~$20 you can't beat this awesome tool.
customer_reviews.author: embellish

customer_reviews.title: simple and works great
customer_reviews.text: I love this product and used it regularly with zucchini over the last month. Only thing to note is that you need a container to catch the food that is lower than the plate that comes out as you shred the food, but truly this works well and is worth the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Julia Bethmann

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. I use it weekly to make zucchini zoodles. I hate cooked zucchini but I love these zoodles. Microwave a minute or two and they are tender enough to eat like spaghetti with marinara sauce and meatballs. A great investment.
customer_reviews.author: vsmitch

customer_reviews.title: This spiralizer is great! I had a handheld spiralizer & it was ...
customer_reviews.text: This spiralizer is great! I had a handheld spiralizer & it was awful. I've used this for zucchini, potatoes & sweet potatoes so far. I like how compact it is & that there is storage for other blades underneath. I think the one negative is that it's a little difficult to clean. You have to take it all apart & if the other size blades are being stored in the bottom part, they will probably get dirty, especially with a juicier veggies like zucchini.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Doyle

customer_reviews.title: ... slicer for over a year now and I still love, love
customer_reviews.text: We've had this slicer for over a year now and I still love, love, love it. We also have cut down on the pasta and have made the zucchini noodles. This is now our favorite way of serving zucchini. I just toss the cut "noodles" in a large frying pan with no added water but a little garlic salt. Cook and stir on med high and it makes enough moisture to cook the "pasta" al dente. So easy to clean. I also pop the blades in the dishwasher. Not very expensive either. Both my daughters and a neighbor bought one too.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie S.from Taylorsville

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: Why does everyone think this is so great? I can't make the stupid spiral fries. I get curve fragments. I even read directions/watched videos/had a serious discussion with the potatoes to no avail. But my review is not based on the fact that I am curly-fry challenged. I also don't think it feesl that "steady" - like plastic could break fairly easily. And clean up is cumbersome - especially in the wedge of the blades.Just was expecting something so much better.
customer_reviews.author: zophra

customer_reviews.title: This slicer did a great job of spiraling many different kinds of vegetables which ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this spiral slicer as a gift for my wife because she follows the Paleo diet and doesn't eat very many carbs. This slicer did a great job of spiraling many different kinds of vegetables which allowed us to make pasta meals with vegetable pasta as substitute. Over all the slicer worked very well, the only reason I am giving it a four star review is because eventually a gear was stripped in the turning handle which made the slicer inoperable. Considering that we used it multiple times a week for nearly a year, I would still recommend this product to others as I believe it was still a good value for the amount of use it received.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonMan

customer_reviews.title: It works amazingly well for some things and amazingly bad for others
customer_reviews.text: It works amazingly well for some things and amazingly bad for others. Do not believe the pamphlet that comes with it, it will not spiralize carrots. A carrot (unless you have a freakishly shaped one) is not the right size or shape to make contact with the blades. a radish will work sort of but you lose about half of it so what's the point? it works real well with summer squash, potatoes, and apples. It isn't too difficult to clean and it's small enough to keep on my admittedly cluttered kitchen countertop. All in all, I'm very happy I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bender

customer_reviews.title: It's as good as they say
customer_reviews.text: There's not much to add that hasn't already been written, but so far I'm thrilled with this gadget. I've only used it with zucchini and cucumbers, but I'm looking forward to using it with beets, sweet potatoes, carrots, cabbage, and more. Even if you don't like zucchini noodles, I find this to be much more useful than the shredder that I had for my kitchen aid stand mixer. I honestly can't see me using that anymore except for shredding huge blocks of cheese -- that's how good this machine is at shredding/noodlizing veggies.
customer_reviews.author: Hedonia

customer_reviews.title: I love this gadget
customer_reviews.text: I love this gadget. Plain and simple. Easy to use, easy to clean, and the suction cups on the bottom are extremely helpful in keeping it in place. The only thing that I would change, if I could, would be that it's not good for small vegetables such as radishes, carrots, or thin cucumbers. When you're done cranking the handle, you're left with at least 1/2 to 1 inch of perfectly good produce that you have to chop by hand because the machine doesn't allow it to push the vegetable or fruit all the way through.
customer_reviews.author: TeeKay

customer_reviews.title: Great for zucchini
customer_reviews.text: I used it to spiralize zucchini and yellow squash, then sauteed the strips in olive oil, s&p. Delish! I cannot, however, get it to spiralize a carrot, which was my main reason for buying it. I wanted a way to add carrots to my salad in a manner that would make them easier to pick up with the other veggies (as opposed to chunks). I bought the largest carrots, but it just turns them into tiny little pieces--no spirals.
customer_reviews.author: Lilacblue

customer_reviews.title: Single Use Appliance - Could do better with smaller device
customer_reviews.text: This is a one trick pony for me. I have tried several vegetables and fruits in it, but zuchinni is the only one that really works well / makes a dish that everyone likes. (I put warm pesto on it and it's delicious) Cucumbers are a wet, pulpy mess. Everything else is just for decoration. And I disagree with other reviewers on the ease of cleaning. I find it kind of a pain to clean and store. If I had to do it over again, I would have purchased a smaller, handheld version that would store easily in a drawer.
customer_reviews.author: CactusGirly

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these from the same company for several years that I liked a lot. The handle broke so I decided to get another one. The new one has had some design modifications and does not work well at all. The suction feet don't stay so it slides when I try to use it. The smallest attachment for spirolizng doesn't completely separate the strands of vegetables. It is very very disappointing. I wish I had my old one back. If I hadn't already thrown it in the garbage, I would try to figure out how to attach a new handle.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: This thing is amazing. I was originally concerned with how long it ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. I was originally concerned with how long it would take to crank it by hand and compared it with the automatic electric ones. The first use proved my fears wrong. It was super easy to use, extremely fast.. In about 15 seconds it spaghettified an entire apple making a delicious snack. The different size blades easily snap in and out to change out aid in extremely quick clean up while offering three different sizes of slices from small- large spaghetti size or spiral chip type slices. So far I have only used apples but I really can't wait to use it to make some homemade squash or zuccini pasta! I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tpetro

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: This really works great. I purchased this last year when we had an over abundance of zucchini from the garden. We eat low carb due to health problems and this little gadget really expands our menu. Many people use it for making potatoes but we use it mainly for zucchini although we have used it for other vegetables like onions as well. There are a couple different brands of the spiral slicers on the market but we have been really pleased with our Paderno. It's easy to use, works great, cleans up well and stores easily. Very pleased and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ⛵⚓Seas the Day⚓⛵

customer_reviews.title: just ok
customer_reviews.text: i wanted to be able to make zucchini noodles but i just can't get the blades to work. they just turn the food to mush. the only blade that works for me is the one that makes round ribbon cuts. the price is affordable and the machine is easy to clean but only having one blade that works makes this very frustrating. i have only used it for zucchini and yellow squash.
customer_reviews.author: vampkel

customer_reviews.title: and I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this (the original) model for about a week now, and I love it!! I read all of the reviews on this one, the newer model, and all of the others. Get this one! I don't care that it doesn't have a catch basin. I don't care that there's a 3/4 inch core after spiralizing my food. I typically snack on it, so nothing goes to waste. If you want to add an awesome new flair to your cooking, or like me, need a replacement for pasta, this is your answer.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Y

customer_reviews.title: It really works!
customer_reviews.text: I have missed spaghetti since I gave up wheat and grains. By using yellow squash and homemade roasted tomato sauce, I can enjoy fabulous flavors and know I am adhering to my nutritional needs. I purchased this product on recommendation from America's Test Kitchen. I have bought 3 other spirilizers that I did not like. This one Works!
customer_reviews.author: Lynette

customer_reviews.title: I'm addicted!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, I am totally addicted to this spiralizer. It is so easy to use and clean up. Why didn't I purchase this sooner??? There are so many recipes out there to use with spiralized veggies and I want to try each one. I've used spiralized veggies in salads, with pasta sauce, and other sauces, just sautéed. I've made curly fries (baked of course). Everything has been delicious. Even my 7-year-old son enjoys helping me do the spiralizing (I would never let him use one of those hand-held ones). And he's loving all the dishes I've made too. For some awesome recipes and ideas, check out
customer_reviews.author: D. Mueller

customer_reviews.title: Best investment for a kitchen tool!
customer_reviews.text: I've used the handheld produce spiral kitchen tools and they can slice your fingers if you're not paying close attention. I haven't had any problems with the Paderno Spiralizer over the years. This product works great with squashes and other produce to make spiral spaghetti or slices.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Robins

customer_reviews.title: this is the one!
customer_reviews.text: When it comes to Spiralizers, this is considered one of the (if not THE) best ones out there. It was easy to use and had all the bells and whistles including the suction feet, being BPA-free, multiple blade choices and was easy to clean. So far I've used with sweet potatoes and easily impressed the grandkids! While I like the product itself, I don't see myself using it much and it will probably end up on a shelf in the basement with my quesadilla maker, the waffle iron, chocolate fountain, etc etc. If you are planning to buy one and doing research, this one gets 2 thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Aleta Haase

customer_reviews.title: Fast and sturdy, easy to clean and a good price!
customer_reviews.text: I just made my first ever Apfelstrudel and I was worried about having to chop and slice up all those apples by hand. But then I remembered, that I had gotten this little helper a while back and wondered if it would help using it. It did. It is a sturdy tool, the suction cups are super sticky and the results are achieved fast and on point. Not too long ago I made cucumber salad with it, using the slicer only blade but for the strudel I used the slicer blade that made thicker apple rings. There is barely any waste and it is super easy to clean up. LOVE, LOVE, LOVE it!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Who knew creating exotic looking vegetables could be so much fun? I've had my Paderno (3-blade version) about a ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the coolest gadget EVER! Who knew creating exotic looking vegetables could be so much fun? I've had my Paderno (3-blade version) about a year. It looks brand new, works perfectly every time, so easy to use. I have no complaints whatsoever, and I highly recommend it to all my friends. Even some husbands get into the act, spiralizing the zucchini. My countertop is smooth Formica and the suction cup 'feet' stick securely, never a problem with the gadget sliding. It has not stained nor discolored in any way, is simple to clean. I just LOVE it!
customer_reviews.author: J.A. in FL

customer_reviews.title: Great little gadget.  Wish I had known about it sooner.
customer_reviews.text: I'm loving this. I had to go to youtube to see how to use it. but this is a great invention. I can't believe I've wasted so much money over the years on mandolins. Every thing that I have tried cucumbers, lettuce, cabbage, zucchini, red onions, firm tomatoes. I has performed great. My main reason for getting this is that I love red onions but it takes so much time to slice them not to mention the smell onions leave on the hands on the eye stinging. With the Panderno slicer, I can slice an onion in less than a minute. I donated all of my old mandolins to the church's yard sale.
customer_reviews.author: Curly Blue

customer_reviews.title: Love slicing vegetables!
customer_reviews.text: This slicer changed my life. Why is it that vegetables sliced like spaghetti are so much more fun to eat? The slicer is great, gets the job done quickly and without a big mess. A few little gripes I have - The blades that cut vegetables into spaghetti-like strips are tough to clean. The sponge can't fit in between the pointy ends without getting shredded. The other one is the little handle that you have to push to move the vegetable along is hard to operate. My hands are a little too small and i can't reach a side of the slicer easily to get traction. But those are not big things and the end result is great!
customer_reviews.author: Lana

customer_reviews.title: Wish It Worked
customer_reviews.text: Although I really wanted this product to work well for me, I have major issues with keeping the veggies in place while rotating the handle. The veggies constantly get too squished or fall off. It's extremely frustrating. I've gone back to using my handheld veggie spiralizer. It's a mess.
customer_reviews.author: Meg Naughton

customer_reviews.title: Making Oodles of Zoodles!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had bought this one (3 blade) first! It is absolutely effortless to turn the bounty from the garden into zoodles in the freezer. Clean up is a breeze, too. My only complaint would be the suction cups have to be pushed down to reset with each zucchini. If they held better, this unit would be perfect! It is still much, MUCH better than the first zoodle make I got, and immediately regretted.
customer_reviews.author: C. Elam

customer_reviews.title: It just won't stand still!
customer_reviews.text: This product is great at spiralizing zucchini, yams, beets and other vegetables. It's enabled me to make more use of my vegetables in meals, particularly to replace pasta with squash. However, the unit will not stand still. Even with four suction cup feet, it requires three hands to operate. One to hold it in place, one to turn the handle and the other to push the vegetable forward. I tried placing it on three different surfaces, no luck. I tried moistening the suction feet, no luck. It just won't stick to the surface. What a shame, otherwise it would be a great product.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed!
customer_reviews.text: After reading the 5 star reviews on this product I purchased it...when I received it I couldn't believe what a cheap piece of plastic it was! It makes a big mess, and when using it on a sweet potato it kept falling off and just spun chipping away the outer skin and not creating the amazing incredible curly strands it claims. The suction cups weren't much use either even though it was on a clean flat counter top. There are better alternatives out there that cost way less!
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Also wasted to much of the veggie since you cant get ...
customer_reviews.text: MUST HAVE IT! I tried one of the hand peeler types for Julienne- its OK..... I tried one of the hand held spiralizers and returned it. Too much work and grated my finger both times I tried to use it. Also wasted to much of the veggie since you cant get your hand down in there but this thing is EXACTLY what I was looking for. My kids love the "noodles" and you can actually make 1 giant long one out of a whole Zucchini if you want. All kinds of great recipes on Pintrest..... you wont be dissapointed. Amazon has the best price- W Sonoma sells these but they are higher.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn - Texas

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: We love this machine!!! We are using it every day :) We also bought a nice recipe book to go along with it for a lot of great ideas. We have used this to cut out all grains and bread and add tons of veggies to all of our meals. We have made so many super yummy dishes already and we don't feel like we are missing out on anything. Yay!!! I can't wait to make even more things! Next on my list is a recipe for sweet potato chocolate chip muffins :)
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best gadget in my kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use & easy to clean. I no longer make /buy/ eat regular pasta-- the veggies have so much more flavor. I've bought a couple of great cookbooks (Inspralized & Nourishing Noodles ) here at Amazon to help inspire me. There is maybe a one hour learning curve with this handy gadget. I even use this to add some veggies to my dog's raw diet ( he's very fond of carrots & beets). After a couple of months of subbing veggies for flour I've lost about 10 lbs. w/o trying.
customer_reviews.author: K. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little gadget to lighten up your meals!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Paderno World Spiral Vegetable Slicer!!! My wife loves pasta and although I like it too it always leaves me bloated!! Pasta is the one of many carbs I try to avoid! This little device has been a game changer for me. Easy to use, easy to clean and you can make vegetable noodles in a matter of minutes. I like to throw the noodles in boiling water for three minutes, then drain, let them cool and use paper towels to gently squeeze out any excess liquids. I then toss the noodles in my favorite sauce.
customer_reviews.author: noelty

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought I didn't like it much and that it'd end up a waste of money. But, that was until I realized I had been using it wrong. I didn't suction it to the countertop (REALLY helps) and I wasn't pushing on the bottom handle to keep the food's pressure on the blades as I was turning it. I was trying to both twirl the knob and keep pressure on it at the same time and that's pretty impossible. Now that I'm using it correctly. I love it. It's so easy to replace pasta this way - just as delicious (if not more) while also faster, easier, and healthier. I'm a big fan.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya P

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Gadget!
customer_reviews.text: Oodles of Zoodles! I love this gadget. I use all the attachments. Makes meal prep easier and healthy eating fun! This was the best purchase I have made in a while! If you are eating healthy, this is the gadget you need!
customer_reviews.author: RA & CO.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these, one for myself and one for my sister. I mostly use it to make salads and zucchini pasta. The knife part is really sharp and I got my nails sliced a few times while cleaning. Careful when you wash this!
customer_reviews.author: Lea

customer_reviews.title: Best gadget ever!
customer_reviews.text: I discovered Zoodles (zucchini noodles) six months ago and have been peeling them by hand. Then I ran across the Inspiralized website, and after seeing what the Paderno spiralizer could do - I ordered! I can't believe how easy it is to use and to clean up. (I use the little OXO round brush, and it's a snap!) I have spiralized zucchini, sweet potatoes, butternut squash, and jicama - can't wait to try even more of the Inspiralized recipes! Note - I ordered the "Paderno" spiralizer from another site, and the handle broke off in less than a week. Make sure you are ordering the Paderno spiralizer from Amazon! :)
customer_reviews.author: Book Addict

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite kitchen gadgets!
customer_reviews.text: I join other consumers with singing the praises of this kitchen gadget. I use it often, and I love making spiralized vegetables from it. My only complaint would be that it is not the easiest kitchen gadget to clean, but it doesn't take long at all. I love having the option of vegetables with spaghetti or in stir-fry, as opposed to noodles. My husband, who is particular about food being the "correct" way, doesn't miss noodles in spaghetti. This is a win in my book! Though I don't have children, I could imagine it being a great way to have children eat vegetables!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle A

customer_reviews.title: It is very easy to use right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I received the Paderno last week after deciding I needed to eat more veggies to get my old body healthier. It is very easy to use right out of the box. I made a cucumber salad for my first use and the slices look professional and are pretty impressive. I am going to try the squash pasta for my next venture. I would suggest you purchase a good cookbook with the product to give you recipes. The product is well made, easy to use and gives you the type of finished product you hoped for. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney Thomas Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Zoodles for everyone!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a REALLY fun kitchen gadget! It's so fun to twist and twirl veggies into edible AWESOMENESS with this thing. Sweet potato fries and zucchini noodles have topped the scales on my favorite things to make so far, but I look forward to having this a long time, and cooking lots of great meals with it! The suction cups, when pressed into place don't move at all, so you can really crank away. Blades are super sharp, Easy to disassemble for cleaning, and you can rinse the main body right in the sink -- super simple. Takes up a little storage space, but that's the price you pay for an awesome veggie tool. :)
customer_reviews.author: RRabago

customer_reviews.title: I love it! I've only had it for two days ...
customer_reviews.text: BUY THIS! I love it! I've only had it for two days thus far, so I can't speak to the long term durability. So far I've made two different zucchini "pasta" dishes with my spiraler. I can see myself using this frequently and eating lots of healthy veggies as a result. It's easy to use, simple to clean. I recommend googling "inspiralize" and check out this blog. She has a videos on how to assemble as well as hot to clean this machine. The only extra thing I needed to clean this was a scrub brush (which I picked up for $4 at the store).
customer_reviews.author: Juliak

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite kitchen appliance!
customer_reviews.text: I got mine today and already gave it a try! I suctioned it to a large metal pan which also caught all the yellow squash noodles I was making. It worked perfectly, was so easy to use, I am thrilled to have made this purchase! It would not suction to my counter or glass cooktop, but the pan worked well. I sauteed the squash lightly in olive oil with fresh garlic and baby kale. Tossed in diced fresh tomato just long enough to heat through and topped with crumbled feta. Seasoned with Montreal Steak Seasoning and voila! Delish! So easy and healthy, and pretty too! I am posting a photo.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Paula Reese

customer_reviews.title: Curly Q veggies
customer_reviews.text: So far this is a great product. I have recently stopped eating meat, which of course means that I eat more veggies. For some weird reason I get super excited when I see my all veggies curly and cute. lol. I'm a lot more interested in eating my fruits and veggies when my plate is colorful and bright. :) Its very easy to use and wash. I hand wash mine.
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne Smith

customer_reviews.title: Kind of fun!
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure if I would enjoy this extra kitchen tool, but it exceded my expectations. Have made zucchini noodles, butternut squash, and carrot spirals and they really are attractive and useful for low calorie ideas. End product is as described. Could see many uses for them, but bet kids would eat more veggies if presented this way. You have a lot of exposed surface area which absorbes seasoning really well making it healthful and flavorful.
customer_reviews.author: jane

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is so easy to use and makes perfect "fake" spaghetti. I have always said that anything with sauce on it has got to be good. Well, this machine proved my point. It is easy and pretty fast. I have used it with zucchini and added sauce and sometimes chicken. It is excellent and a low fat/carb meal. I used it for carrots but since they are hard you have to give more of a push. I did too much pushing and broke the handle off. It is still usable though but be careful - the handle makes it easier to use. It is easy to clean too.
customer_reviews.author: PattyCake

customer_reviews.title: Game changer!
customer_reviews.text: Must have item for any healthy kitchen, paleo kitchen, gluten free kitchen - or anyone who loves veggies. Made multiple meals out of zucchini noodles, and now starting to experiment with other veggies like sweet potatoes! Super easy to clean too. Also much better than the hand-held spiralizer, definitely worth the extra 15 bucks. Bought the cheaper option when I first decided to try spiralizing, but it was tough to use and made a mess so it's been in the drawer for a about a year now un-used. This one i've had for a month and hsed about 10 times already!
customer_reviews.author: Meesh

customer_reviews.title: fool your family into eating healthy 'pasta'!
customer_reviews.text: Ok. So I have had my share of kitchen gadgets from zesters to juicers to rotisseries. This tool is totally AWESOME. It doesn't take up a tremendous amount of space but it's design makes it awkward for cabinet storage and drawer storage is completely out unless you have some deeper drawers. But forget storing it because you're going to use it all the time! I make zucchini and other squash 'noodles', sweet potato and regular potato curly fries, beet noodles, apple ribbons.... and the blades are SUPER sharp. Cuts beets like soft butter. Don't let the white scare you; if you clean up quickly stains are not an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Emmer

customer_reviews.title: Useful gadget. As a vegan
customer_reviews.text: Useful gadget. As a vegan, I have found many uses for it in turning vegetables into versatile dishes. It could improve if it stayed put more firmly. As it is, it tends to wobble as you use it. The suction at the legs should be stronger.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriela Castellanos

customer_reviews.title: Plastic Dandy
customer_reviews.text: We also have the Kitchenaid (KA) spiralizer tool but butternut squash was a real loser, thus this contraption. Yeah, it's all plastic and probably won't last the way we'll like beyond its one-year warranty, but butternut squash doesn't stand a chance now. Besides, I no longer am called by the superior species to carry our heavy KA mixer to the prep counter and load its "spiro thingy," like breakin' down a shotgun...js
customer_reviews.author: JFSAZ

customer_reviews.title: Great kitchen tool for larger veggies and fruits
customer_reviews.text: After eyeing one of these for about a year, we finally decided to purchase it. The blades are easy to interchange, it's easy to use (my four-year old son loves to help out!) and everything is relatively easy to clean. The only reason why I am giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is that the center "plug" that the vegetable rotates on is ~1/2" in diameter. This means that for carrots, small squash, etc. it becomes quite difficult to spiralize these vegetables. Would be great if there was a cutting plate for these thinner veggies.
customer_reviews.author: C. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Spiral Right To My Heart
customer_reviews.text: This is quite a useful kitchen gadget! Whether you’re a vegetarian, gourmet chef (for the evening), or just looking to have some fun, it’s the tool for you. I was skeptical at first, due to the multiple parts and it being plastic, but upon use I was impressed. The three different blades allow you to adjust size and thickness of the spirals for different dishes. I’m a big fan of spiraling zucchini and sautéing them for a healthy replacement to pasta. My only complaint is that the suction on the bottom to keep the slicer steady could be stronger. Overall, this is a fun/functional device to keep your meals interesting, exciting and healthy.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Fishel

product_meta.title: Paderno World Cuisine 3-Blade Vegetable Slicer / Spiralizer, Counter-Mounted and includes 3 Stainless Steel Blades
product_meta.description:
Style:3-Blade| Color:White

PADERNO WORLD CUISINE SPIRAL VEGETABLE SLICER
The Paderno World Cuisine vegetable slicer creates spiral cuts and vegetable or fruit noodles in seconds. The frame and blade plates are con-
structed of very high-quality, impact-resistant ABS plastic that is BPA-free, and the blades are made of stainless steel. It has four powerful
suction feet that are fitted with tabs for easy release, and does not require an outlet connection or batteries.

Key Features: * Mounts to countertop with ease due to its strong suctioning base
 * Unit is made of BPA-free ABS plastic
 * Blades are made of stainless steel
 * Easy-to-clean - components are dishwasher-safe
 * Dimensions: 12 x 6 x 8.8 in (30.5 x 15.2 x 22.3 cm)
 * Weight: 1 pound (450 g)

Simple to use:Secure the slicer to a smooth working surface by pressing down on each corner (Note: the rotating crank should face your left or right side).
Attach one side of the vegetable or fruit to the small circular corer on the blade plate and gently press the prongs onto the opposite end. Use
one hand to push the lever handle along while simultaneously turning the crank handle with the other hand. Your vegetable or fruit can mea-
sure up to 10 inches long and 7 inches thick, and must be at least 1/2 inch thick in diameter. Suggestions of vegetables and fruits to use are
zucchini, carrots, cucumbers, sweet potatoes and apples.

Paderno World CuisineFounded in 1925 under the name of "Alluminio Paderno" and specialised in the production of aluminium pots and pans for the household,
today Paderno is a leading international brand in the manufacture and sale of professional cookware and kitchen items for the restaurant
and hospitality industry.

Includes: 1 x Vegetable spiralizer / slicer plus 3 blades for vegetable strands & zucchini noodles
BPA-Free base. Blades made of ABS plastic frames and stainless steel blades. Dishwasher safe.
